page.title: 12Religious Beliefs in Laggan
page.content: The present congregation of the presbyterian Church of Scotland are this year celebrating the 200th anniversery of the present building. The site of a previous church has been found at Blaragie Farm. The Minister now serves the parish of Newtonmore as well as Laggan. With Laggan including Dalwhinnie & Loch Laggan, the Minister at present travels the widest parish in Scotland. This is the only congregation with a church in which to worship. Those of the catholic faith have to travel to Kingussie to attend mass. There was a catholic church at Crathie (see History) seating 200 every Sunday. De-population caused it to be closed and demolished and taken to Elgin. As far as is known christianity is the only religion practised in Laggan.
